description: On March 16, the Finnish Government's Ministry of education and culture has adopted policy recommendations for the education sector. "Early childhood education and care units and the pre-primary education associated will be kept in operation. However, the Government recommends children being cared for at home."For primary and lower secondary education, school premises will be closed until 13 April 2020 and contact teaching will be suspended. As an exception, pre-primary education organised in schools and contact teaching for pupils in grades 1 to 3 will continue for the children of parents who work in sectors critical to the functioning of society. The premises of schools, educational institutions, universities, universities of applied sciences, basic art education as well as civic education and other liberal education institutes will be closed until 13 April 2020, and contact teaching will be suspended. Teaching and guidance will be organised as widely as possible in alternative ways, including distance learning. These arrangements were entered into force on Wednesday 18 March 2020. On March 31, the exceptional arrangements for education were announced to be extended until 13 May, and considering the situations of the pandemic, possibly to the end of the term.

description:
On 29 April, the Finnish government decides to reopen early childhood education, childcare facilities, and primary and lower secondary education institutions in a controlled manner under strict guidelines. The guidelines that must be met include:
- avoidance of unnecessary physical contact
- arranging teaching premises more spacious than usual
- school break times and school meals must be held with the student's own class or group
- no large gatherings, such as spring festivals
- personnel must work with the same group of children and hygiene guidelines must be strictly respected

The school year is set to end on 30 May.

description:
"On 4 August, Finland's Ministry of Education amends the Act on Vocational Education and Training temporarily. If, for reasons attributable to the coronavirus epidemic, a demonstration of the professional skills and competence required to pass a qualification module cannot be conducted in authentic work situations and processes, a student may demonstrate his or her professional skills and competence by performing other practical tasks that are as similar to authentic work situations and processes as possible. In addition, the demonstration of skills and competence can be supplemented with other types of competence assessment more flexibly than at present.

In higher education institutions, a student may register as a non-attending student during the first academic year if he or she is prevented from starting his or her studies due to an official regulation related to the epidemic or for another epidemic-related serious reason. If studies are delayed due to exceptional teaching arrangements introduced by a higher education institution because of the coronavirus epidemic, this will be taken into account when deciding on the extension of the right to study. The amendments made to the Act on Vocational Education and Training, the Universities Act and the Universities of Applied Sciences Act will remain in force until 31 July 2021."

description: On 4 August, Finland's Ministry of Education announces new measures for early childhood education and care. Early childhood education and care should be organised so that groups are not mixed or combined. Staff members in early childhood education and care should also work with the same group of children. Children starting school or early childhood education and their parents will be given an opportunity to familiarise themselves with activities in advance, provided that good hygiene is ensured and there are not too many people in the same space at the same time. Children may bring along an important toy and take it home at the end of the day.

description: On 4 August, Finland's Ministry of Education announces new measures for schools and educational institutions. In primary schools, the different teaching groups should be kept separate throughout the school day. Activities should be staggered with the aim that that there are few people in the same space as possible. Staff members should also avoid assembling, which means, for example, that teachers should hold their meetings remotely. If contact teaching cannot be organised safely - as will be assessed in cooperation with regional authorities, then contact teaching and distance learning can be alternated, by placing groups in distance learning in alternate weeks. This does not apply to students in years 1-3 who have special needs support or students in extended compulsory or preparatory education. Students have the right to school meals, support for learning and school attendance, study guidance, and students benefits during exceptional arrangements.

Alongside foreign seasonal labour, measures are also being prepared to secure the availability of Finnish labour'. The essential tasks requiring foreign labour are:

description:
On March 16, Finland announced that it will halt inbound passenger travel 'as soon as possible' with the exception of Finnish nationals and residents returning home to Finland.On April 6, Finland's Ministry of Agriculture and Forestry and Ministry for Economic Affairs and Employment decide, based on a joint working group formed in March, that the 'use of foreign seasonal labour is particularly important in tasks requiring expertise gained from previous years’ work at the location in question. Alongside foreign seasonal labour, measures are also being prepared to secure the availability of Finnish labour'. The essential tasks requiring foreign labour are: 1) agriculture, horticulture and fisheries, 2) the food sector, 3) energy supply, 4) maritime and manufacturing industries, 5) construction, 6) transport and communications, 7) chemical industry, 8) pharmaceutical and health technology industries and 9) the forest sector. As a general rule, the government recommends that access to premises providing 24-hour care and treatment remain limited to staff.
